channel.title: Posts on Flavio Morelli
channel.description: Recent content in Posts on Flavio Morelli

item.title: The Covid-19 lab leak theory is a textbook example of confounding
item.description: Ever since the start of the Covid-19 pandemic, there has been widespread speculation on the origins of the virus.

item.title: Some resources to learn about pharma and biotech
item.description: A year ago, I got the opportunity to work as an intern at a large pharmaceutical company.

item.title: Death by a thousand cuts: the future of machine learning programming
item.description: In the world of statistics and machine learning, there are many different opinions on what the future holds for scientific programming – specifically, Python, R and Julia.

item.title: Book Review: Hidden Truths by David Fubini
item.description: For those of us who are not in business consulting, it is sometimes hard to truly understand what sets apart top strategy firms like McKinsey, BCG or Bain.

item.title: Membership tests in Julia, R and Python
item.description: Membership tests – checking whether an element is in a collection – is a common operation in statistical programming.

item.title: The problem with interpreting biased coefficients
item.description: One of the first things people learn about regression analysis is how to interpret coefficients and it is seemingly easy.

item.title: 5 Book Recommendations from the summer of corona
item.description: Summer is almost over, so I thought I would share some books I have learned something from during the last couple of months.
